definitions.definition: To shape metal by striking it, especially with a peen.
A needle without an eye (usually) made of drawn-out steel wire with one end sharpened and the other flattened or rounded into a head, used for fastening.
A small nail with a head and a sharp point.
A cylinder often of wood or metal used to fasten or as a bearing between two parts.
definitions.example: Pull the pin out of the grenade before throwing it at the enemy.

definitions.definition: The victory condition of holding the opponent's shoulders on the wrestling mat for a prescribed period of time.
A slender object specially designed for use in a specific game or sport, such as skittles or bowling.
(in plural) A leg.
definitions.example: I'm not so good on my pins these days.

definitions.definition: Any of the individual connecting elements of a multipole electrical connector.
definitions.example: The UK standard connector for domestic mains electricity has three pins.

definitions.definition: A piece of jewellery that is attached to clothing with a pin.

A simple accessory that can be attached to clothing with a pin or fastener, often round and bearing a design, logo or message, and used for decoration, identification or to show political affiliation, etc.
A scenario in which moving a lesser piece to escape from attack would expose a more valuable piece to attack.
The flagstick: the flag-bearing pole which marks the location of a hole
The spot at the exact centre of the house (the target area)
definitions.example: The shot landed right on the pin.

definitions.definition: A mood, a state of being.
One of a row of pegs in the side of an ancient drinking cup to mark how much each person should drink.
Caligo.
A thing of small value; a trifle.
A peg in musical instruments for increasing or relaxing the tension of the strings.
A short shaft, sometimes forming a bolt, a part of which serves as a journal.
The tenon of a dovetail joint.
A size of brewery cask, equal to half a firkin, or eighth of a barrel.
A pinball machine.
definitions.example: I spent most of my time in the arcade playing pins.

definitions.definition: (often followed by a preposition such as "to" or "on") To fasten or attach (something) with a pin.
(usually in the passive) To cause (a piece) to be in a pin.
To pin down (someone).
To enclose; to confine; to pen; to pound.
To attach (an icon, application, etc.) to another item.
definitions.example: to pin a window to the Taskbar

definitions.definition: To fix (an array in memory, a security certificate, etc.) so that it cannot be modified.
definitions.example: When marshaling data, the interop marshaler can copy or pin the data being marshaled.

definitions.definition: To cause an analog gauge to reach the stop pin at the high end of the range.
